description: Scenario attempts to find a non-standard Lucky button variant that does not exist on Google homepage. Known flake in regression suite.
rootCause: The element '#i-am-feeling-extra-lucky' does not exist on the Google homepage. Google only renders standard 'I'm Feeling Lucky' variants and hides some in specific locales. This is a known test selector mismatch — the test should target '#gbqfba' or 'input[name=btnI]' instead.
evidenceHighlights: Selector '#i-am-feeling-extra-lucky' has no match in current DOM
Standard 'I'm Feeling Lucky' button is present with different id

actionPlan.planSummary: Update the selector to target the correct Google button element

actions.description: Skip this interaction — the target element is a test artefact
actions.rationale: Known pattern: element never exists on google.com. Skipping prevents noisy failures.

notes: Seed pattern for the @local-resolution Cucumber scenarios. Do not delete.
